summary: Milind S. Gadgil, M.D., was disciplined after being found practicing medicine while impaired by alcohol. Coworkers reported he smelled of alcohol and displayed concerning behavior, leading to positive breathalyzer tests with high blood alcohol content during work hours. As a result, his Nebraska medical license was suspended for six months, and the Maryland Board of Physicians reciprocally suspended his Maryland license until the Nebraska license is reinstated.
